meanings.sent1: The acerbity of the lemon made my face scrunch up.
meanings.sent2: The acerbity of the vinegar was too much for my taste buds.
meanings.sent3: Despite its acerbity, the sour candy was surprisingly popular at the party.
meanings.sent4: The acerbity of the unripe fruit was a sharp reminder of nature's cycles.
meanings.sent5: I will never forget the acerbity of that bitter medicine.

meanings.definition: Harshness or severity in manner or tone
meanings.sent1: Her acerbity towards her colleagues made the work environment tense.
meanings.sent2: The teacher's acerbity towards the students was uncalled for.
meanings.sent3: Despite his acerbity, his friends knew he had a kind heart.
meanings.sent4: The acerbity in her voice cut through the room like a sharp knife.
meanings.sent5: The acerbity of his criticism left a lasting impact on the team.
